exclusion: Tap either the top or the bottom of the ZDW20 switch once.
inclusion: Tap either the top or the bottom of the ZDW20 switch once.
label: ZDW120
overview: The ZDW120 Wall Mounted Dimmer is a component of the HomePro lighting control system. Wire the Wall Mounted Dimmer in place of the standard wall switch according to the diagram above and program from the Wireless Controller to operate loads. Inclusion of the ZDW120 Wall Mounted Dimmer on the ZTH100 Wireless Controller menu allows remote ON/OFF control and dimming of lights connected

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Ignore Start Level Bit When Dimming
parameters.description: Defines the behavior when transmitting dim commands
parameters.overview: The ZDW120 can send Dim commands to Z-Wave enabled dimmers. The Dim command has a start level embedded in it. A dimmer receiving this command will start dimming from that start level. However, the command also has a bit that indicates whether the dimmer should ignore the start level. If the bit is set to 1, the dimmer will ignore the start level and instead start dimming from its current level. To clear this bit, configure this parameter to the value of 0.

parameters.label: Suspend Group 4
parameters.description: Disable transmission of command to Group 4
parameters.overview:
You may wish to disable transmitting commands to Z-Wave devices that are in Group 4 without “un-associating” those devices from the group. Setting parameter 2 to the value of 1 will stop the ZDW120 from transmitting to devices that are “associated” into Group 4.
It is possible that you may only want the units in Group 4 to track when the dimmer is being turned ON and OFF and not when dimming.

parameters.label: Night Light
parameters.description: Defines the behavior of the blue LED.
parameters.overview: Default is Night Light mode where LED is on when switch is off.

options.label: LED on when switch is OFF
LED on when switch is ON

parameters.label: Invert Switch
parameters.description: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.
parameters.overview: Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

parameters.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
parameters.description: This dimmer will start dimming from its current level.

parameters.label: Don’t Send Level Command after Dim
parameters.description: Change behavior of dim level information update
parameters.overview: When you press and hold the bottom of the ZDW120 paddle once, the Z-Wave devices that are associated into Group 1 are sent the Dim command. After you release the paddle, the ZDW120 follows up by commanding the devices to go to the same level of the ZDW120. By default, the ZDW120 is set not to do this. To enable ZDW120 to do this set this parameter to 0.

parameters.label: On/Off Command Dim Step
parameters.description: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

parameters.label: On/Off Command Dim Rate
parameters.description: Sets the rate at which the dimmer changes the light level.
parameters.overview: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds

parameters.label: Local Control Dim Step
parameters.description: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

parameters.label: Local Control Dim Rate
parameters.overview: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dimmer will change.

parameters.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
parameters.description: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

parameters.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
parameters.description: Sets the dim rate for the all on/off command
parameters.overview: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dimmer will change.

parameters.label: Disable Group 4 During a Dim Command
parameters.description: Change behavior of command to Group 4 during Dim Command
parameters.overview: After the ZDW120 is commanded to stop dimming, it will then command the Z-Wave devices in Group 4 to the ZDW120’s new level. To prevent the ZDW120 from commanding the Z-Wave devices in Group 4 during this particular occurrence, set Parameter 13 to the value of 1.

parameters.label: LED Transmission Indication
parameters.description: Change behavior of LED during transmission to group 1-4
parameters.overview: The ZDW120 will flicker its LED when it is transmitting to any of its 4 groups. This flickering can be set to not flicker at all (set to 0), to flicker the entire time it is transmitting (set to 1), or to flicker for only 1 second when it begins transmitting (set to 2). By default, the ZDW120 is set to flicker for only 1 second.

associations.label: Group 4
associations.description: Group to update transmitter or controler
